meanings.definition: In a pompous or overblown manner
meanings.sent1: He spoke bombastically, trying to impress everyone with his exaggerated stories.
meanings.sent2: The politician bombastically promised to solve all the country's problems in one day.
meanings.sent3: The cat strutted bombastically around the room, as if it owned the place.
meanings.sent4: Her laughter echoed bombastically through the empty hall, drawing everyone's attention.
meanings.sent5: The fireworks lit up the sky bombastically, dazzling the spectators.

meanings.sent1: The bombastically decorated cake caught everyone's eye at the party.
meanings.sent2: Her bombastically written novel was full of flowery language and dramatic scenes.
meanings.sent3: The clown's bombastically colored outfit made the children giggle with delight.
meanings.sent4: The artist's bombastically painted mural covered the entire side of the building.
meanings.sent5: The bombastically designed car turned heads wherever it went.

meanings.definition: Characterized by grandiose or boastful speech
meanings.sent1: The bombastically proud peacock strutted around the farm, showing off its feathers.
meanings.sent2: His bombastically loud voice could be heard from across the room.
meanings.sent3: The bombastically confident salesman convinced everyone to buy his product.
meanings.sent4: The bombastically arrogant king believed he was above all others.
meanings.sent5: The bombastically ambitious plan aimed to revolutionize the industry.
